intro: Hieracium pindigenum, commonly known as the Pindus hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium pindigenum is often found in open areas with full sun exposure.
